reviewText:
CubeGun is an interesting concept done horribly, horribly wrong. Between the terrible port of an iOS game, the broken English, and just the game breaking bugs that don't even allow me to continue the game, I can't choose what is worse.

Here's a quick look video if you want to see this for yourselves, or simply read the rest of my review for the sad truth of this game.

http://youtu.be/YHwAvmdHSWM

So let me just start by what drew me into this game, the ability to make and customize your ship and levels. It seemed pretty neat that you could make a ship however you want and launch yourself at your foe. The rock, paper, scissors mechanics of the guns is cool, too. Machine guns are devastating but shields render them pretty useless, but torpedoes can blow through shields no problem, while anti-missile guns can stop the torpedoes even getting near you and so on. And the best bit of all this is that you can combine different weapons together to make up for their weaknesses. It's a pretty solid concept. But done very, very wrong.

Let me start with the gameplay. After customizing a ship to your liking with limited resources, you get thrown into battle with no warning or start-up screen. Your curiously silent weapons are blazing like no tomorrow, and there's absolutely nothing you can do to stop them. The only controls you're allowed are moving with WASD, so the only thing you have to do is point yourself at the enemy and strafe to win. Yup, that's it. And once you win the match with this method, your met with a low-res banner stating you won. Needless to say, it didn't feel like I did.

The next thing I couldn't help but notice was the terrible English littered everywhere. Sometimes the tutorials made me more confused about what something did rather than help. But hey, I can overlook it since this game isn't exactly story driven. So I pressed on some more, and encountered some interesting and overpowered enemies to fight. But rather than use my crappy weapons compared to theirs, I just used the terrible AI to my advantage and watched them drive themselves into cliffs. That seemed to be the most effective method of taking dudes down. Hell, sometimes they ran into walls themselves without me having to do anything. It was kinda funny, but mostly sad to watch.

But still, I continued like this was a guilty pleasure until I couldn't go on anymore. Not because I reached the end, but because the game is broken and doesn't allow me to. It won't let me go any farther in the single mode, Island Loot is still locked for whatever reason, and the multiplayer is dead on launch day. There wasn't a single game going. I tried scrolling what seemed infinitely through the level selection menu, but all I saw was the levels I did and lots of blank screens. And thus that led me here to this review since I can't continue beyond that point.

I'm not even gonna bother ragging on the obviously large touch buttons and poor mouse controls, so I'll wrap it up here. Don't get this game unless you want to be disappointed by a cool concept like me. Maybe if they patch this mess of a port and it goes on a steep sale will this be worth it. But for now, stay away. Stay far away.
voteText: 95 of 145 people (66%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ReviewContentReviewProsConsAuto BattlesThis game mode is for the lazy people who had just enough ambition to make either three bots that easily cooperate with each other or three of the same robots that are over powered enough to obliterate every other type of robot.  In this game mode you have three bots that go over to enemy bots and slap away at their bots, the winner is the one left standing, or you could trash all of that if you enemy has a black hole launcher or cannons that just pushes you away until time runs out and the defender wins. These strategies usualy involve one tank bot and two other shooter placeb behind them, or all of the bots are tanks and shooters. I know that their are more complicated stradegies that can go into this game mode but those can only be expanded by buying better weapons.1.Easy to play game mode
2.Easy to regain bullets
3.If you win a match it will put you with stronger opponents
4.If you loose a battle it will match you up with weaker opponents
5.Variety of stradegies
6.Has the oppurtunity to choose starting position1.Limited amount of bullets
2.Small chance of winning against stoger opponents
3.Sometimes AI is completly stupidFleet battlesThis game mode is for the people who are less lazy then the poeple who are mlg at Auto Battles, I currently consider this their primary game mode because is is listed as the first game mode on the list and it also has their own in game currency to play it ,oil. This game mode is one were people can have the same strats as a the Auto Battles but instead of haveing three uncontrollable bots that go and try to kill the other bots you have to kill the other teams thing? I have no idea what it's called but it's a shiny ball of light.  The strategic view about this game mode is that you buy bots with electric thingies based on the weight of that bot meaning that if you are low level then you have a chance of winning if you send out alot of small bots that ae able to destroy your opponents larger bot. This gammode is by far the most balanced game mode, and has close to no flaws.1.Strategies include bot design as a requirement
2.Strategies include when to use which bot
3.Strategies include makeing small cheap bots for spamming
4.Strategies include large bots for taking out aeverything
5.Strategies include pretty much everything
6.Good balance between strong and weak bots
7.Good balance between the person winning and the person loosing1.Getting wrecked by people with hammers and lazersBoss battlesEvery good boss is pretty much three huge hammers with shields, AA guns,  and a few magnets. This boss has close to no counter unless you consider standing at the back of the safe zone with your two freinds all with lazers and thrusters to avoid the magnets.1. Alot of strategy involved with making a good boss
2. Auto Battles and Boss Battles share the same currency required to play(bullets)
3. Bullets are easy to regain
4. Gives you boss points that you can spend at the boss shop
5. Allows you to move around your bot in a 2D mode1. The rewards are OK but I find I get more out of Auto Battles
2. Everyone makes pretty much the same bossMultiplayerUnlike the rest of the game modes this one is a third-person shooter were you can Wreck them scrubs.  Their are two types of game modes Get the Ball (PvP) or Survival (PvE).  Get the ball is a game mode in which you are in a 3D Arena and you control one of your bots and your goal is to run into a floating ball which you then carry around, when you have the ball you are slowed and have less defence, you have to carry that ball for around a whole minute.  I don't think that this game mode gets you much gold or metal as survival because you only get gold or metal from killing other people but if you kill a person more then once then they imediatly rage.  Survival is were you and some other people are trying to protect 3 Power Ups from hoards of AI robots, at first this may seem like you are recieving nothing but in actuality once you get to the higher waves you start recieving more then 50 gold and metal per round.  In both of these game mode everyone who wants to get kills uses bots with giant hammers on them because their is currently no counter to them.1.OH BABY A TRIPLE! and MOM GET THE CAMERA!
2. No cost to play
3. Good gold and metal gain
4. Wrecking them scrubs1.Everyone uses a hammer
2. Hammer = OP
3. Getting wrecked like a scrubCommunityThe community that this game has is one of the nicest communities that I have every seen in a game, The people their are realy accepting and answer almost every question about the game. Don't know were to start after going through the toutorial, ask the community.  Want more friends to play the game with you, ask the community.  Don't know were to cummunity is, ask the.. wait, it's right here. Want to find a a different game to play that is not Cubegun, ask.. NO ONE! This game also has a very friendly in-game global  chat that im sure would also be friendly.. if anyone used of course.1.You can ask almost any question you want
2. You can search for friends
3. You can eaven ask why some game modes were taken out even though they are mentioned all over the place1. The creaters of this game are also  all over the community and accept almost any good and realistic ideas that you throw at them, an example of this is that the tracking missile were an idea suggested by this person and now it's an in-game weapon.  And then their is the spelling. I find that I aquire OCD purely based on the fact that everything is in a forign language and acts as though english is the secondary language, nor is their a language canging button to change that. Thier is also the fact that somethings are spalled miscorrectly in english, an example is how Get the Ball is spelled Get the Bal, they should just rename it Get the Other L in Bal. Early Access Review

I've loaded the game to find that 1234 people (the defaulting fail number) are supposedly online and the world fails to load...
I've loaded the game to find that no one is online and the AI does rediculous things (like running away from the battlefield into oblivion) and the game goes into a stalemate idle...Photo here:  http://steamcommunity.com/id/pugsprofile/screenshots/?appid=299420
I've seen text prompts that overwrote other text prompts (all in VERY broken English) so much so that I could not understand what it was trying to tell me (so the game became a chore to click and explore)...
And when the combat worked" it was not enjoyable and felt extremely automated...

And all of this in under one hour. This game is a "Do Not Buy" title!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't let the unrecommends stop you, it's free, try it!

That being said, cubegun is a shooting game where you build a ship, slap it with turrets and spam projectiles at your enemies. The weapons are quite varied, and the synergy effect is functioning properly (e.g. Nothing is undefeatable). Currently there are 2 solo modes and 2 online modes.

The devs are real active, and they sometimes release updates and bugfixes daily! They are also very open to feedback, and as such, the game improved A LOT over the year.

Still, the lack of players means there will usually only be 1~3 servers for multiplayer, and player fleet battles are real uncommon. However, you will usually find somebody to play with. There are still a whole lot of bugs, and UI needs improvement as it looks ♥♥♥♥ now.

I would give this a 8/10, it's not a must-play, but you will most likely have fun.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nCubeGun is a pretty unique airship fighting game that I had not heard of until yesterday while browsing Steam. Having played a couple hours I can say that the population is really low but the gmaepaly is there if a little buggy. In CubeGun you craft airships out of blocks and equip weapons and propulsion, from the tutorial it seems you can control ships either with a third person perspective manual, or with an RTS style mouse drag and click. I dont have much experience with the game but from I played it looks like something I hope gets a little more popular so it can improve.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a low level you start of with practically nothing. So you run up against some lvl 2 who decided to buy a mortar, game over for you.
Technically not pay-2-win, because you could grind to a mortar (or anything) yourself, but this simply means that you'll be outgunned and outbalanced in an arms race.

The weirdness started in my first game where I was matched against some dude +5 levels. He started spewing out his army of custom mades and I still was on defaults. Little clue is given on what you have to do and how the controls work, so I just sat trying to figure out how to build stuff (actually that I had to build stuff). Once I had that figured out his army was up to my base and I spawned in the default fleet. I simply held the line. There was nothing he could do to counter my (default) fleet. He quit after a couple of minutes and I went up to his base and won.

This game needs to provide a challenge to each participant. Now it simply is run up to each other, see who has the bigger guns and the loser quits.

Game breaking bugs, terrible, terrible typos, and awful controls.

Bugs: Basically, can't get past the tutorial. It needs me to be lvl 9 to play the next level, I am lvl 8, flawlessly destroyed EVERYTHING in every level, and you can't repeat levels for getting the exp to level up.

Typos: 1th level 1? Machine gun sub? Launch Rocketer!? And this is a north american game!

Controls: Mouse controls everything except for guns, which is keyboard, and the buttons are all over. a, h, 1, and i. Plus, no rebinding and no settings apart from audio.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good idea, I could see it being fun. However, the ship editor controls are clunky, the editing is limited and editing ships takes longer than it probably should. Combat is alright, but should be a bit more fluid and accurate. There are very few players playing the game and the game didn't allow me to Quit without pressing Alt F4.

At this time I wouldn't recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game was great, I played is excessively trying to get #1 on the leaderboard, was at #2 for quite sometime until my competition cheated.

The changes that happened to the game destroyed a lot of what made me love it and so I had to stop playing. If you're getting introduced to it in this state you might enjoy it.

EDIT: I'm still #10 on the leaderboard after having not played for 6+ months. Super broken ranking system.
